meanings.definition: A small protein released by cells that has a specific effect on the interactions between cells, on communications between cells, or on the behavior of cells.
meanings.sent1: The cytokine helped the cells communicate better with each other.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying how cytokines affect cell behavior.
meanings.sent3: The cytokine threw a party for all the cells to improve their communication skills.
meanings.sent4: The cytokine acted like a messenger, delivering important instructions to the cells.
meanings.sent5: The cytokine was like a tiny conductor orchestrating the cell interactions.

meanings.definition: Any of a class of immunoregulatory proteins that are secreted by cells especially of the immune system.
meanings.sent1: The immune system relies on cytokines to regulate its functions.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are researching the role of cytokines in immune responses.
meanings.sent3: The cytokine organized a protest among immune cells demanding better working conditions.
meanings.sent4: The cytokine acted as a general, commanding the immune troops in battle.
meanings.sent5: The cytokine was like a superhero, protecting the immune system from harm.
